intro: Erythrodes formosana, commonly known as the Formosan redleaf, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its distinctive red-colored leaves. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments and thrives in well-drained soil. Its ornamental value is due to its vibrant foliage and unique leaf structure. However, it is relatively rare and faces threats from habitat loss and environmental changes.
